content: this text is a legal document explaining the progress of a divorce case and the subsequent liquidation and partition of the matrimonial property regime the parties involved are referred to as mr r and mrs c the document begins by stating that the notary is opening the liquidation and partition operations of the joint ownership it provides background information on the marriage and the fact that the parties are belgian nationals the divorce proceedings were initiated by mrs c based on irretrievable disunion and mr r opposed the application the court granted the divorce and the judgment was served mrs c also requested the appointment of a notary for the liquidation and partition of the matrimonial property regime and notary j was appointed the document records the attendance of mrs c and mr r at the opening of the operations the text concludes with a summary of the claims and documents presented by mrs c and mr r it discusses the assets and liabilities involved as well as the claims made by mrs c the parties have agreed to appoint an expert to determine the market rental value of a property and the expert will issue a preliminary report the parties will have the opportunity to submit their observations on the report before a final report is prepared the notary will then request urban planning information to verify the legality of the property the parties will have 6 weeks to file their statements of claims and each party will have the opportunity to respond to the other partys claims the session is closed and the parties will need to provide their residence addresses for future notifications the minutes of the meeting were read and signed by the parties
